item.title: Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO DLC pack ‘Hero of Justice’ announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/dragon-ball-sparking-zero-dlc-pack-hero-of-justice-announced

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Adds 11 new playable characters.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Spike Chunsoft have announced Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO‘s first downloadable content pack, “Hero of Justice,” which adds 11 new playable characters, one costume, and three custom battles. It will launch for Season Pass holders on January 20, and for everyone else on January 23.

The new playable characters include Gohan (SH) and variants, Piccolo (SH) and variants, Gamma 1, Gamma 2, and Cell Max.

Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam.

item.title: Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero demo now available in the west
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/phantom-brave-the-lost-hero-demo-now-available-in-the-west

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Play through the first two chapters of the game.

Following its release in Japan in December 2024, the demo for Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero is now available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch in the west, publisher NIS America announced.

The demo features the first two chapters of the full game, and save data from the demo can be carried over to the full game when it launches.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via NIS America:

In Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero, the story follows Marona—a gifted young girl with the power to speak to Phantoms—as she traverses the ocean world of Ivoire, providing aid to those in need. When a fleet of ghost ships attack, it’s up to Marona and her new friend Apricot to assemble the legendary crew that once defeated these spectral foes.

Recruit Phantoms, bind them to objects, combine them with Gadgets, and even merge them with Marona herself to unleash show-stopping abilities and sink the Shipwreck Fleet!

Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on January 30 worldwide, followed by PC via Steam in spring 2025.
